data.title: Nigerian States
data.text:
WorldStatesmen.org HOME >

return to Nigeria>> to Nigeria Regions to 1967 >>

Nigeria States

States:Abia - Adamawa - Akwa Ibom - Anambra - Bauchi - Bayelsa - Benue - Borno - Cross River - Delta - Ebonyi - Edo - Ekiti - Enugu - Gombe - Imo - Jigawa - Kaduna - Kano - Katsina - Kebbi - Kogi - Kwara - Lagos - Nassarawa - Niger - Ogun - Ondo - Osun - Oyo - Plateau - Rivers - Sokoto - Taraba - Yobe - Zamfra - Federal Territory: Federal Capital Territory - Former States: Benue-Plateau - East Central - North-Eastern - North-Western - Western - Former Territory:Lagos Federal Territory -

Note: In 27 May 1967 the regions were dissolved and 12 states created, subsequently further divided into 19 states and a federal capital territory (3 Feb 1976), 21 states (23 Sep 1987), 30 states (27 Aug 1991), and 36 states (1 Oct 1996).

Party abbreviations: APC = All Progressives Congress (progressive, merger of ACN, ANPP, CPC, and APGA dissidents, est.6 Feb 2013); APGA = All Progressives Grand Alliance (progressive, est.2003); LP = Labour Party of Nigeria (social democratic, est.2002); NNPP = New Nigeria People's Party (right-wing, syncretic, Third Position, est.2000);PDP = People's Democratic Party (social conservative, est.1998); PPA = Progressive People's Alliance (progressive, federalist, est.2003); Mil = Military; - Former parties: ACN = Action Congress of Nigeria (progressive, 2006-2013);AD = Alliance for Democracy (progressive, 1998-2006, merged into AC);ANPP = All Nigerian People's Party (conservative, anti-communist, 1998-2013); APP = All People's Party (coalition of associations, 1998-2003, then ANPP); CPC = Congress for Progressive Change (progressive, 2009-2013);GNPP = Great Nigerian People's Party (split from NPP, 1978-1983); NPN = National Party of Nigeria (coalition, 1978-1983); NPP = Nigerian People's Party (social democratic, 1978-1983); NRC = National Republican Convention (conservative, 1989-1993); PDM = People's Democratic Movement;PRP = People's Redemption Party (progressive, center-left, 1978-1983); SDP = Social Democratic Party (center-left, mainly northern, 1989-1993); UPN = Unity Party of Nigeria (social democratic, seen pro-Yoruba, 1978-1983)

Federal Capital Territory, Abuja

Abuja City Flag

Current Flag

17 Mar 1976 Federal Capital Territory, Abuja (created from parts of Benue-Plateau, North-Central and North-Western states).

administered by the Federal Capital Development Authority (FCDA).1 Feb 1979 FCDA headquarters is moved from Lagos to Suleja.

24 May 1985 Ministry of the Federal Capital Territory (MFCT) established and

the FCDA is subordinated to it.

12 Dec 1991 Seat of federal government offices moved from Lagos to Abuja.

7 Jan 1994 Presidential office moves to Abuja.

31 Dec 2004 Federal Capital Territory Administration created replacing the

MFCT.
